  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  EPH Introduction  <<<<<<<<<<<<

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  EPH Chapter 1  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 + N V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Paul, apostle (i.e., missionary) of Christ Jesus through the will of God—|
 +P  V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |To the saints (i.e., God’s people) who are in Ephesus and to those who are faithful in Christ Jesus:|
 +   V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Grace and peace to you from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.|
 +   V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Blessed is the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, He Who blessed us with every spiritual blessing|
     v 3                                |imaginable in the spiritual domain in Christ, |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |just as in love He chose us in him before the foundation of the world to be holy and unblemished when|
     v 4                                |subjected to His scrutiny, |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |having determined beforehand that He would adopt us, making us His sons through Jesus Christ, according|
     v 5                                |to the benevolent thought-process of His will, |
     V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |resulting in praising the glory of His grace, which in an act of mercy and kindness He gave us by means|
     v 6                                |of the Beloved-One, |
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |in whom we have the Redemption (i.e., the master-plan to put our lives back to the way they were supposed|
     v 7                                |to be) through his blood, the forgiveness of the trespasses which caused us to need redemption in the|
     v 7                                |first place, according to the riches of His grace, |
     V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |which He copiously showered on us with every kind of wisdom and thought-process imaginable, |
     V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |having made known and understood to us the mystery of His will, according to His benevolent thoughts|
     v 9                                |which He purposed and put forth openly in him |
     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |for the management of when the eras of history come to a head, resulting in the redefinition of every|
     v10                                |last thing in the Messiah, the Christ, every last thing that resides in the spiritual domain and on the|
     v10                                |Earth—all things in him, |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |in whom we also received an inheritance (i.e., things which have been parceled out and reserved specifically|
     v11                                |for us, and for us only, to receive or walk, spiritual or otherwise. The plan for us to have such things|
     v11                                |is immutable. ) which has been predestined (i.e., decided upon ahead of time) according to the plan and|
     v11                                |purpose of the One who works every last thing according to the deliberation of His will, |
     V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |resulting in us being disposed to praise His glory, we who have set our hope in Christ beforehand, |
     V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and in whom we also, having heard the ultimate message of truth, the Gospel of our salvation (i.e., the|
     v13                                |good news that there is a program in place to rescue us and protect us from calamity), in which, now|
     v13                                |that we have believed this message, we were sealed (i.e., identified as belonging to someone or intended|
     v13                                |for some purpose and labeled and marked as genuine as such) by the guaranteed-by-promise Holy Spirit,|
     V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |who is the down payment of our inheritance up until we take delivery of what was purchased, resulting|
     v14                                |in praising His glory.|
 +   V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |On account of this, having heard about your expression of the Faith, a faith which is in the Lord Jesus,|
     v15                                |and the love which you show to all the saints, |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I also haven’t stopped offering thanksgiving for you, bringing you up in my prayers, |
     V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of Glory, will give you a spirit (i.e., a prevailing|
     v17                                |attitude; an all-encompassing mindset that reaches down deep into the heart, into your own human spirit)|
     v17                                |of wisdom and revelation in a recognition and an arrived-at, more precise knowledge and understanding|
     v17                                |of Him, |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |which is the eyes of your heart having reached the point where they’re enlightened resulting in us knowing|
     v18                                |for a fact what is the hope of our calling (i.e., what the full potential and ramifications are of us|
     v18                                |being chosen and accepted by God), what is the wealth of the glory of His inheritance that’s been distributed|
     v18                                |among the saints, |
     V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and what is the over-the-top greatness of His power made available to us, we who believe in accordance|
     v19                                |with the actuation of the might of His strength (i.e., the sheer amount of force He’s able to bring to|
     v19                                |bear when He unleashes his power), |
     V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |which he actuated in the Messiah, the Christ, having raised him from the dead and having seated him at|
     v20                                |his right hand (i.e., having taken his position of God’s chief executive officer) in the spiritual domain,|
     V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |superseding by far all rule and authority and power and dominion and every name which has been named|
     v21                                |(i.e., every authority which has ever been established; every person or being who’s ever been given or|
     v21                                |has otherwise assumed a position of authority) not just in this age—no—in the Age to Come as well. |
     V22              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And He subjected all things under his feet (i.e. God made all things absolutely subservient to Christ,|
     v22                                |to be forcefully dominated by him), and gave him—the one who’s the head over all things—to the church,|
     V23              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |which is his body, the maximum amount which every little bit of everything is filled to.|
 +   V--         SPACER_BEFORE_CHAPTER: ||
    [ EPH Chapter 1 has no footnotes ]

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  EPH Chapter 2  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And while you were dead (i.e., dead spiritually: in a stagnation of waste, joylessness, futility, and|
     v 1                                |destruction) in your trespasses and sins, |
     V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |in which you went about day in, day out back then according to the age (era) of this world (i.e., according|
     v 2                                |to the philosophies, attitudes, and beliefs that are in vogue in this particular era of human history),|
     v 2                                |according to the ruler of the authority of the air (i.e., according to the being who determines the underlying|
     v 2                                |unseen power that influences and guides human society), the spirit who now works in those who take it|
     v 2                                |upon themselves to be disobedient, |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |you also conducted your lives this way among them back then, living by the desires of your flesh (i.e.,|
     v 3                                |your carnal nature), acting out the wants of the flesh and of the thoughts which randomly enter your|
     v 3                                |mind, and you were by nature characterized by indulgence in violent emotions just like everyone else.|
 +   V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But God, rich in mercy because of the great amount of love which He has, loved us, |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and we, dead in the trespasses I mentioned earlier, were made alive in Christ—by grace you have been|
     v 5                                |saved— |
     V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and were raised in conjunction with him and seated jointly with him (i.e., given joint authority with|
     v 6                                |him) in the spiritual domain in Christ Jesus, |
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so that the over-the-top riches of His grace in goodness in Christ Jesus would be showcased by being|
     v 7                                |lavished upon us in the coming ages. |
     V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |You see, by grace you have been saved through faith, and this grace—the gift of God—does not originate|
     v 8                                |from yourselves, |
     V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |it does not originate from works, so that no one would have bragging-rights. |
     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |You see, we are His handiwork, created in Christ Jesus in a position to handle the good works which God|
     v10                                |has waiting in the wings for us to occupy our day-to-day lives with.|
 +   V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In light of this, recall that in flesh (i.e., according to your physical bodies which indicate the method|
     v11                                |and means by which you approach God) you were “the Gentile Nations” back then, those called uncircumcised|
     v11                                |(i.e., not God’s people) by those called circumcised in flesh by hand (i.e., God’s people according to|
     v11                                |a ritual performed by humans), |
     V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |because in that phase of your life you were apart from Christ, excluded from the political and social|
     v12                                |community of Israel and strangers to the covenants of promise, hopeless and godless in the world. |
     V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But now you are melded with Christ Jesus; you being far away back then became close by the blood of Christ.|
 +   V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |The fact is, He personally is our peace, who made both peoples into one and by means of his flesh tore|
     v14                                |down the dividing wall—the animus—|
     V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |having abolished the wall, namely the Law of Moses which consists of the commandments of God enumerated|
     v15                                |in decrees, so that by means of him He would merge the two entities into one new entity, making peace|
     v15                                |by doing so, |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and by means of one body would reconcile both to God through the cross, having killed the animus by means|
     v16                                |of him. |
     V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And he went and proclaimed the glad-tidings message of peace to us who are afar and peace to those who|
     v17                                |are near, |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |the message that through him both entities have the access I’ve been talking about in one Spirit to the|
     v18                                |Father.|
 +   V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |So I’ll state this emphatically: you’re no longer strangers and foreign-residents, but fellow-citizens|
     v19                                |of the saints and households of God (i.e., God’s people, historically speaking) instead, |
     V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |built on top of the foundation of the apostles and the prophets, Christ Jesus being the foundation’s|
     v20                                |main anchor point, |
     V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |in whom you too are being custom-built into a dwelling place of God in the Spirit.|
 +   V--         SPACER_BEFORE_CHAPTER: ||
    [ EPH Chapter 2 has no footnotes ]

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  EPH Chapter 3  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Now about grace of this sort: I Paul the prisoner of Christ Jesus on behalf of you who are the Gentiles|
     V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |(assuming you’ve actually heard about the responsibility assigned to me to manage the grace of God, grace|
     v 2                                |which was conveyed by me to you), |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |am telling you that through the agency of revelation the mystery of this grace was made known to me just|
     v 3                                |as I briefly wrote about before |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |for the purpose of you being able to think through my understanding of the mystery of Christ by reading|
     v 4                                |what I wrote, |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |a mystery which in other decades and centuries wasn’t made known to the average person like it’s now|
     v 5                                |been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets by means of the Spirit, |
     V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |namely that the Gentiles are to be joint-heirs, to share the same body with, and to be joint-partakers|
     v 6                                |of the promise by means of Christ Jesus through the Gospel, |
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |which I became a minister of according to the gift of the grace of God which was given to me reflective|
     v 7                                |of the actuation of His power.|
 +   V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |This very grace was given to me, the least worthy of any of the saints (i.e., those who believe in Christ)|
     v 8                                |to evangelize to the Gentiles the unfathomable riches of Christ—riches which cannot be tracked like a|
     v 8                                |predator tracks its prey— |
     V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and to make visible and apparent to anyone and everyone what is the program by which the mystery of what|
     v 9                                |has been hidden away in God Who created all things from those who lived in the various ages, |
     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so that at the present time the multi-faceted wisdom of God would be made known and understood to the|
     v10                                |demonic rulers and the demonic authorities in the spiritual domain through the church, |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |according to the plan and purpose of the ages, which He executed by means of Christ Jesus our Lord, |
     V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |in whom we have the open, bold, and confident means of access in our having reached the point where we’re|
     v12                                |fully convinced through the faith we have in him. |
     V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In light of this I ask that you not lose heart in the deluge of the severe difficulties I face for your|
     v13                                |sake, a thing in particular which focuses on you.|
 +   V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Now back to talking about grace of this sort: I genuflect before the Father, |
     V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |out of Whom every lineage, be it race, tribe, clan, family, or whatever, in the heavens (i.e., the sky|
     v15                                |above, heaven, and the spiritual domain) and on the earth are named (i.e. are assigned their role and|
     v15                                |authorities), |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |that, according to the riches of His glory, He would grant you to be strengthened with power in the inner-self|
     v16                                |through His Spirit, |
     V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |for Christ to take up residence through the faith in your hearts, while being rooted and anchored in|
     v17                                |love, |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so that you, joined by all the saints, would be equal to the task of grasping the sheer magnitude of|
     v18                                |the width, length, height, and depth of this grace, |
     V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and to comprehend what’s beyond comprehension—the love of Christ—so that you would be filled with the|
     v19                                |goal of reaching all the fullness of God.|
 +   V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Now to the One Who’s able to do far above and beyond all that we ask or think, doing it in lockstep with|
     v20                                |the power which works in us— |
     V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |to Him be the glory in the church and in Christ Jesus extending out to all the generations that will|
     v21                                |forevermore come. And let us pause a moment for that to sink in.|
 +   V--         SPACER_BEFORE_CHAPTER: ||
    [ EPH Chapter 3 has no footnotes ]

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  EPH Chapter 4  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I ask you with all sincerity—I the prisoner in the Lord—to go about your day-to-day lives in a worthy|
     v 1                                |manner, |
     V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |with every kind of and the utmost extent of humility, gentleness, and self-restraint there is, with patience,|
     v 2                                |putting up with one another in love, |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |while being eager to maintain the unity of the Spirit by means of the bond of peace— |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |There is one body of believers and one Spirit of God, just like the fact that you were called in one|
     v 4                                |hope of your calling (i.e., you were summoned by God to be believers in a summoning that has one and|
     v 4                                |only one hope in mind)— |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |One Lord, one faith, one baptism (i.e. there is only one way to become a Christian, and it is done once|
     v 5                                |only)— |
     V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |One God who occupies the role of Father of all things: namely the One Who’s on the top of the heap; Who|
     v 6                                |all things exist on account of Him, by means of Him, and through Him; and Who is in, with, and among|
     v 6                                |all things.|
 +   V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Now the unearned gift which God gives out of His kindness was given to each individual according to the|
     v 7                                |specific amount and peculiar characteristics of the gift of Christ. |
   N V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In light of this the Book of Psalms says,|
 +PN V 8            SPACER_INTER_PROSE: ||
 +PN V 8                  VERSES_PROSE: |Once he ascended to a high place,|
 +PN V 8                  VERSES_PROSE: |He bedazzled the captives—|
 +P  V 8                  VERSES_PROSE: |He gave gifts to the people on Earth|
 +   V--            SPACER_INTER_PROSE: ||
 +   V 9 VERSES_NON_INDENTED_NARRATIVE: |Now as a side note, how can he who ascended (i.e., the person referred to by this quotation from Psalms)|
     v 9                                |possibly be anyone other than the person who descended into the lower part of the Earth (i.e., the world|
     v 9                                |beneath the Earth, the underworld, the place where the dead go and where hell is)? |
     V10 VERSES_NON_INDENTED_NARRATIVE: |The person who descended is the same person referred to in Psalms here who ascended far above all the|
     v10                                |heavens (i.e., to a position which completely supersedes and has complete dominion over the entire spiritual|
     v10                                |domain, including all spiritual creatures and all activity in the spiritual world) in order to fully|
     v10                                |take ownership of all the things that were promised to him.|
 +   V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And as far as the gifts that were given, this same person—the one who both descended and ascended—granted|
     v11                                |that, some here and some there, there be the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, and the overlapping|
     v11                                |roles of pastor and instructor (i.e., those who do one or more of the following: leading the congregation;|
     v11                                |instructing the congregation as to what the rules are; laying down rules when needed; explaining the|
     v11                                |Scriptures and the Christian faith)— |
     V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |for the equipping of the saints (i.e., the believers) towards the goal of the work of the ministry, towards|
     v12                                |the goal of the building up of the body of Christ, |
     V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |until—should the time ever come—we all attain the unity of the Faith and the recognition and the arrived-at|
     v13                                |knowledge and understanding of the Son of God, with the goal of becoming a full-grown man (i.e., getting|
     v13                                |our act together) to the point where we reach Christ’s height and body-weight, |
     V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so that we’d no longer be young children, jostled and carried about by every wind of teaching among the|
     v14                                |cheap hustles that pool sharks dream up to con people; |
     V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |but, while being straight-up about the truth in a spirit of love, we would grow to the same stature as|
     v15                                |him in all respects, who is the head, |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |from whom the entire body is being assembled into a single, cohesive unit by examining each part, seeing|
     v16                                |how it logically fits into the big picture, then putting the entire unit together—a body which is connected|
     v16                                |through every supporting ligament according to a pattern of operation where each one of the members does|
     v16                                |its share to cause the growth of the body towards the goal of the building up of itself in love.|
 +   V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |What I’m telling you—and I swear by it in the Lord—is this: No longer go about your day-to-day lives|
     v17                                |as the Gentiles (i.e., the random people out yonder who have no relationship with God; the nations which|
     v17                                |populate the earth) do in the futile, foolish, senseless, and worthless state of their minds, |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |being darkened in their end-to-end thought process, estranged from the life of God on account of the|
     v18                                |ignorance which exists in them and furthermore on account of the state of hardness, dullness, and insensitivity|
     v18                                |of their hearts, |
     V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |people in particular who, having reached the point where they’re so callous that they’re not bothered|
     v19                                |by the implications of what they do, have relinquished control of themselves in their giving of themselves|
     v19                                |over to an unrestrained indulgence in lewd and immoral physical pleasures towards the end-result of practicing|
     v19                                |all sorts of filthy, disgusting things in a yearning for more and more of the same.|
 +   V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But you did not learn (i.e., successively come to appreciate and build an understanding of) Christ this|
     v20                                |way, |
     V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |if you really heard him and were taught by him (according to the premise that truth is in Jesus) |
     V22              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |to repeatedly put aside the old-self in regard to the former lifestyle you used to live, the old-self|
     v22                                |who’s degenerating as a consequence of the carnal desires of “the delusion” we’re all-too familiar with—|
     V23              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |but doing this while being renewed in the prevailing attitude and disposition of your mind— |
     V24              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and to put on once and for all the new-self, who, as directed by God, was created in righteousness and|
     v24                                |holiness—without fault both from a human and from a divine perspective—derived from the truth.|
 +   V25              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In light of this, now that you’ve put aside the mendacity that used to be a part of your conversation,|
     v25                                |as Zechariah says, “Each person ought to speak truthfully when he’s with his neighbor,” since you belong|
     v25                                |to one another. Psalms says, |
     V26              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |“Be angry and don’t sin when you are”—don’t let the sun set on your wrath (i.e., be angry but don’t be|
     v26                                |consumed by the emotion, not putting the anger away when you should), |
     V27              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |nor give place to the devil (i.e., close off any opportunities for the devil; don’t allow him to gain|
     v27                                |a foothold anywhere). |
     V28              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Let the person who steals no longer steal, but rather have him toil, working for the common good using|
     v28                                |his own hands, so that he would have the wherewithal to give to the one in need. |
     V29              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Don’t let any rotten word (including ideas and topics of conversation) come out of your mouth, but rather|
     v29                                |let something come out of your mouth that contributes positively to the problem at hand, so that it would|
     v29                                |give grace (i.e., it would be a gift of kindness, graciousness, and goodwill to those who don’t deserve|
     v29                                |the same) to those who hear. |
     V30              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God or cause him pain, in whom you were sealed (i.e., certified|
     v30                                |and labeled as genuine or as belonging to someone) for a day of redemption (i.e. to a point in time where|
     v30                                |things are made to be what they’re supposed to be or restored to what they used to be). |
     V31              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Let any sort of bitterness, rage, anger, shouting, or blasphemy (i.e., swearing at someone, trash-talking|
     v31                                |about someone, smearing or slandering the reputation of someone) be removed from you together with any|
     v31                                |sort of malice. |
     V32              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In the same situations, become kind to one another, tender-hearted and compassionate, and gracious, forgiving,|
     v32                                |and extending goodwill just as God in Christ was gracious, forgiving, and extended goodwill to you as|
     v32                                |well.|
 +   V--         SPACER_BEFORE_CHAPTER: ||
    [ EPH Chapter 4 has no footnotes ]

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  EPH Chapter 5  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Become imitators of God as children who are loved, |
     V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and go about your day-to-day lives in love, just as Christ loved you and handed himself over to be crucified|
     v 2                                |for your sakes as a sacrificial offering with the goal of giving off an aromatic aroma when incinerated|
     v 2                                |as a burnt offering. |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But fornication (i.e., sexual immorality) and uncleanness (i.e., any immoral practice which is filthy|
     v 3                                |and disgusting) of any sort or greed—don’t even mention it among yourselves, as not mentioning these|
     v 3                                |things is what’s appropriate for the saints (i.e., those who believe in Christ). |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And things you ought to be ashamed of saying because they’re morally unacceptable or they’re obscene;|
     v 4                                |and stupid, foolish babbling or sexual innuendos—that which ought not be spoken—don’t say these things,|
     v 4                                |but rather speak words of gratitude all the more. |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In fact, wrap your head around this: All fornicators, those who practice uncleanness, or those who are|
     v 5                                |greedy (which is idolatry) don’t have an inheritance (i.e., don’t have a piece carved out for them) in|
     v 5                                |the kingdom of Christ and God.|
 +   V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Let no one deceive you with empty words: the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience (i.e.,|
     v 6                                |those who take it upon themselves to be disobedient) because of these things, |
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so don’t partner up with them. |
     V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |You see, you were darkness back then, but now you are light in the Lord: go about your day-to-day lives|
     v 8                                |as children of light |
     V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |(As a side-note, the fruit (i.e., the byproduct) of light can be found in any kind of and all sorts of|
     v 9                                |goodness, righteousness, and truth), |
     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |giving your approval to what is pleasing to the Lord. |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And don’t take part in the fruitless (i.e., no long-term benefit) works of darkness, but expose them|
     v11                                |instead; |
     V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |for the things which take place in secret which are done by them are embarrassing to even talk about.|
     V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Now everything which is exposed by the light gets brought out in the open, plain for all to see. |
   N V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In fact, anything which itself brings things out in the open and makes them plain to see is light. Therefore|
     v14                                |it says,|
 +PN V14            SPACER_INTER_PROSE: ||
 +PN V14                  VERSES_PROSE: |You there who’s sleeping: get up|
 +PN V14                  VERSES_PROSE: |And arise from the dead|
 +P  V14                  VERSES_PROSE: |And Christ will shine on you (i.e., he’ll appear to you)|
 +   V--            SPACER_INTER_PROSE: ||
 +   V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |So see to it that you go about your day-to-day lives monitoring whether your lives are up to standard|
     v15                                |in every aspect, not living as an unwise person but as a shrewd and wise one, |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |making the most of the time and taking advantage of every opportunity, because it’s bad out there. |
     V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Because of this, don’t get to where you’re careless, reckless, thoughtless, or stupid, but rather constantly|
     v17                                |understand what the will of the Lord is. |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And don’t get drunk on wine—in which is a reckless disregard for your own self-preservation—but be continuously|
     v18                                |filled with the Spirit while in the Spirit instead, |
     V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |speaking among yourselves or to yourselves in popular songs accompanied by instruments, songs of praise,|
     v19                                |and spiritual songs (i.e., prophetic manifestations of the Holy Spirit put to song, including singing|
     v19                                |in tongues), singing in general and singing popular tunes—tunes which may be accompanied by musical instruments—with|
     v19                                |the heart to the Lord, |
     V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |always offering thanksgiving for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God the Father, |
     V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |submitting to one another in a reverence of Christ bordering on fear.|
 +   V22              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Wives are to submit to their husbands as though submitting to the Lord, |
     V23              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |since the husband is the head of the wife as Christ is the head of the church, he personally being the|
     v23                                |savior of the body. |
     V24              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Anyways, as the church submits to Christ, this is the same way that wives are to submit to their husbands|
     v24                                |in all aspects.|
 +   V25              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Husbands, love your wives just as Christ loved the church and surrendered himself and was taken into|
     v25                                |custody for her sake, |
     V26              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so that he would set her apart and make her holy after cleaning her up in the bathtub with the word of|
     v26                                |God, |
     V27              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so that he personally could present to himself the church imbued with glory, having no spot, wrinkle,|
     v27                                |or anything of that sort, but instead that she would be holy and blameless when presented. |
     V28              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |The way that husbands ought to love their wives is as if they were their own bodies. He who loves his|
     v28                                |wife loves himself; |
     V29              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |the fact of the matter is that no one ever hated his own flesh, rather cherishes and nourishes it, just|
     v29                                |as Christ cherishes and nourishes the church, |
     V30              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |because we are a part of his body. |

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  EPH Chapter 6  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Children, obey your parents as part of your walk with the Lord; this is the right thing to do, you see.|
     V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |”Honor your father and mother,” which is the foremost commandment found in the Law of Moses with a promise|
     v 2                                |appended to it: |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |”…So that it would go well with you and you would be blessed during your stay on the planet.” |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And, parents, don’t exasperate your children but raise them in the discipline, coaching, mentoring, and|
     v 4                                |instruction of the Lord instead.|
 +   V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Slaves and menial servants, obey those who are your masters or bosses in the natural with the utmost|
     v 5                                |reverence and respect in the simplicity of your heart (i.e., without making something bigger out of it)|
     v 5                                |as if being reverent to Christ, |
     V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |not just making the boss think you’re doing a good job when he’s looking and acting up when he’s not|
     v 6                                |but obeying as though you’re Christ’s slave instead, doing the will of God from the soul, |
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |serving with a good attitude as if your service is to the Lord and not to humans, |
     V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |knowing for a fact that each person, if he were to do something in particular which is good, he’ll get|
     v 8                                |this same thing back from the Lord, whether slave or free. |
     V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And masters and bosses, treat them the same way, giving up the constant threat of punishment as your|
     v 9                                |primary means of motivating your slaves, knowing for a fact that in the spiritual domain the Lord is|
     v 9                                |master and boss of both them and you, and there is no favoritism based on position in society or such|
     v 9                                |with him.|
 +   V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In conclusion, be strong in the Lord and reach into the vastness of his power. |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Put on all the components of God’s complete suit of armor so you’ll have the ability to stand against|
     v11                                |the schemes of the devil, |
     V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |because the fight we’re in isn’t against flesh and blood, but against the rulers (i.e., the evil spirits|
     v12                                |who have dominion at the top of a hierarchy, presumably over other evil spirits), against the authorities|
     v12                                |(i.e., the evil spirits with power over a specific area), against the world-dominators of this darkness|
     v12                                |(i.e., the evil spirits who dominate the ungodly human system and society that is the darkness we’re|
     v12                                |surrounded by), against the spirit-forces of wickedness in the spiritual domain.|
 +   V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |On account of this, take up God’s complete suit of armor, so that you’ll be able to withstand the spiritual|
     v13                                |forces of the devil in the day of evil and—after you’ve accomplished everything on that day—to stand.|
     V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |So stand, after having fastened the belt of truth around your waist, and having put on the breastplate|
     v14                                |of righteousness, |
     V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and having put on your feet the preparation of the good-news message of the Gospel of peace, |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |in all situations having taken up the shield of faith, by which you’ll be able to extinguish and knock|
     v16                                |out all the Evil One’s flaming projectiles, |
     V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and having received the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit (which is the word of God), |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |with every sort of prayer and supplication (i.e., an urgent request put into prayer) praying in every|
     v18                                |season of life in the Spirit, and while at it with maximum perseverance and prayer be on the lookout|
     v18                                |looking around to see how all the saints (i.e., believers) are doing, |
     V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and for me, so that a message may be given to me when I open my mouth to boldly make known the mystery|
     v19                                |of the Gospel |
     V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |(for which I’m an ambassador kept on a short leash) so that with the same I will speak out freely, boldly,|
     v20                                |and confidently as it is incumbent on me to speak.|
 +   V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Now, so that you too would know what’s going on with me and how I’m doing, Tychicus, a dear brother and|
     v21                                |a faithful assistant in the Lord, will fill you in on everything, |
     V22              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |whom I sent to you with that very goal in mind, so you’d know what I’m up to and that he’d give your|
     v22                                |hearts encouragement and comfort.|
 +   V23              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Extend a greeting of peace to the brothers and love with faith from God the Father and the Lord Jesus|
     v23                                |Christ. |
     V24              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Grace be with them who love our Lord Jesus Christ with sincerity.|

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  PHIL Introduction  <<<<<<<<<<<<

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  PHIL Chapter 1  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 + N V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |From Paul and Timothy, slaves of Christ Jesus,|
 +P  V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |To all the saints (i.e., believers) in Christ Jesus who live in Philippi together with the bishops (i.e.,|
     v 1                                |head pastors; overseers) and deacons (i.e., assistant pastors; assistants entrusted with significant|
     v 1                                |responsibilities; heads of ministry departments):|
 +   V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.|
 +   V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I give thanks to my God every time I think about you while reminiscing, |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |always making every one of my requests put into prayer for you all with joy, |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and I give thanks for your working closely with me in the spreading of the Gospel (i.e., the good-news|
     v 5                                |message of Christ) from the first day until the present. |
     V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I’ve reached the point where I’m convinced of this very thing, that He who began a good work in you will|
     v 6                                |complete it, working towards that ends until the day of Christ Jesus, |
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |just as it’s right for me to be thinking about all of you this way, on account of me having you both|
     v 7                                |in my heart and in my chains and in the verbal defense and confirmation of the certainty of the Gospel—you|
     v 7                                |all being my fellow-workers of this grace.|
 +   V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In this regard, God is my witness to the fact that I long for all you with the deep, inner affections|
     v 8                                |of Christ Jesus. |
     V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And I pray this, that your love would proliferate even more and more in recognition, in more precise|
     v 9                                |knowledge, and in every sort of insight gained from perception, |
     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |resulting in your continual testing and approving of those things which excel, so that you would be sincere|
     v10                                |and won’t get tripped up and would maintain this to the day of Christ, |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |having reached the point where you’ve been filled from the byproduct of righteousness which is through|
     v11                                |Jesus Christ to the glory and praise of God.|
 +   V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I want you to know, comrades, that the situation I find myself in has further advanced the Gospel, |
     V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |in that an awareness and understanding of my bonds in Christ has been made known among the entire palace|
     v13                                |guard detachment and among everyone else, |
     V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and many of the comrades in the Lord, urged on by my bonds, are much more daring about going around speaking|
     v14                                |the word of God without fear.|
 +   V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |While it’s true that some preach Christ because they’re motivated by jealousy and strife, on the other|
     v15                                |hand some are motivated by good intentions. |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |While they who spread the Gospel out of love know for a fact that I’ve been appointed to give a verbal|
     v16                                |defense of the Gospel, |
     V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |on the other hand they who proclaim Christ out of ambition and not with sincerity expect to stir up vexation|
     v17                                |for me while I’m in jail. |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |So what?—except for this: that Christ is proclaimed in all respects, whether with ulterior motives or|
     v18                                |with no hidden agenda, and in this I rejoice—and indeed I will rejoice, |
     V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |for I know for a fact that this will result in deliverance for me through your prayer and the support|
     v19                                |of the Spirit of Christ Jesus, |
     V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |in line with my eager expectation and hope that I won’t be embarrassed or humiliated in any way, but|
     v20                                |rather with every sort of frankness, forthrightness, and openness imaginable Christ will be magnified|
     v20                                |now—as always—in my body, whether through life or through death.|
 +   V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |You see, the way I see it, to live is Christ and to die is gain (i.e., is advantageous; is a desirable|
     v21                                |option). |
     V22              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |If I live on in the flesh, this will yield tangible results from my work. And what will I choose?—I can’t|
     v22                                |tell; |
     V23              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I’m caught between the two, having the desire to be set free again and to be together with Christ, for|
     v23                                |this is much, much better. |
     V24              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But to remain in the flesh is more necessary for your sakes. |
     V25              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And convinced of this I know that I will remain here on Earth and stay by your side—with all of you—for|
     v25                                |your progress and for the joy which comes from faith, |
     V26              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so that your grounds for speaking proudly would proliferate in Christ Jesus by my doing, on account of|
     v26                                |me visiting you again.|
 +   V27              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Only let your life in society be worthy of the Gospel of Christ, so that, whether I come and see you|
     v27                                |or am away, I hear what you’re up to, that you stand together in one spirit, one soul, joined together|
     v27                                |by the Faith of the Gospel |
     V28              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and are not frightened and intimidated by anything done by your adversaries, which in particular is indicative|
     v28                                |of their ruin, but of your salvation (i.e., your being kept from ruin); and this intimidation-ruin-salvation|
     v28                                |pattern is from God, |
     V29              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |since the thing given—undeservedly so—to you on Christ’s behalf is to not only to believe in him but|
     v29                                |to suffer on his behalf, |
     V30              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |having the same anguish and conflict as he did, the very thing you saw happening to and in me and now|
     v30                                |hear reports are happening to and in me.|

     V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I have no one, you see, who sees things the way I do, a certain someone who’ll truly care for you. |

 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In conclusion, my dear comrades, rejoice in the Lord. It’s no problem at all for me to write this over|

 +   V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Look at the dogs (i.e., those who are worthless, contemptuous people who live like animals; those who|
     v 2                                |are excluded from having a covenant with God) and don’t stop looking at them, look at those who do evil,|
     v 2                                |look at the anti-circumcision (i.e., those who think they have a covenant with God but the opposite is|
     v 2                                |true). |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |The fact of the matter is that we are the circumcision (i.e., you’re the ones who actually have a covenant|
     v 3                                |with God), the ones who have a service of worship in the Spirit of God and make audacious remarks in|
     v 3                                |Christ Jesus and have no confidence in the flesh (i.e., in your own selves; in your abilities apart from|
     v 3                                |God to please God; in your ability to gain God’s favor by simply following a list of rules; in your human|
     v 3                                |credentials), |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |although I have confidence in the flesh. If some other person has confidence in the flesh, I have more.|
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Circumcised on the eighth day; an Israeli by race, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew who stands out|
     v 5                                |among the Hebrews; a Pharisee who was totally committed to doing everything according to the Law of Moses;|
     V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |as far as the intensity of his zeal, a person who was persecuting the church; as far as his pursuit of|
     v 6                                |a righteousness (i.e., a means of standing before God and telling Him why He should approve of your life)|
     v 6                                |which is generated by means of following the Law, faultless.|
 +   V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Never mind all that—whatever gain (i.e., advantages) I had, I consider it to be lost (i.e., to have been|
     v 7                                |forfeited) on account of Christ. |
     V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Oh, no, no—even I consider everything forfeited on account of the surpassing greatness and excellence|
     v 8                                |of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, on account of whom everything has been forfeited, and I consider|
     v 8                                |everything to be garbage and crap so that I may gain Christ |
     V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and that I would be found in him not having my own righteousness, one which is derived from following|
     v 9                                |the Law but instead one which is through the faith of Christ, which is a righteousness from God on the|
     v 9                                |basis of the Faith— |
     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |to come to know him and the power of his resurrection and the sharing of and participation in his sufferings,|
     v10                                |while being conformed to his death, |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |if somehow I might attain the breaking free from and rising from the dead.|
 +   V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Not that I’ve already attained these things I’m writing about or have reached the point of perfection,|
     v12                                |but I’m chasing after these things in the hope that I just might put them under my thumb, on the basis|
     v12                                |of me having been put under the thumb by Christ Jesus. |
     V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Comrades, I don’t figure that I’ve reached the point where I’ve put these things under my thumb, but|
     v13                                |I do this one thing: I forget about what’s behind me and press on to what lies ahead of me. |
     V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I keep my eye on the ball and chase after the prize of God’s high calling in Christ Jesus. |
     V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |So any person at all who’s mature, may we be of this opinion; and if you are of a different opinion,|
     v15                                |God will reveal this to you. |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In any event, let’s be diligent about maintaining what we’ve already attained.|
 +   V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Become people who imitate me, comrades, and pay careful attention to those who live their day to day|
     v17                                |lives using us as role-models. |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |You see, many live their day to day lives in the opposite manner, people whom I was constantly writing|
     v18                                |to you about, but now—even while crying—I’m telling you are the enemies of the cross of Christ, |
     V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |people whose destination is destruction, whose god is their belly and who take delightful pride in their|
     v19                                |shame, who are consumed with thinking about earthly things. |
     V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |As far as we’re concerned, though, the country that we’re citizens of exists in the heavens (i.e., in|
     v20                                |the spiritual domain and in heaven itself), from which we also eagerly await a savior, namely the Lord|
     v20                                |Jesus Christ, to come out of, |
   N V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |who will transform our humble, lowly, abased bodies into a body of his glory done in a way which is consistent|
     v21                                |with him operating in what he’s capable of and with him making all things subject to himself.|

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  PHIL Chapter 4  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |…So my dear comrades whom I miss very much, my joy and my crowning achievement, make your stand in the|
     v 1                                |Lord this way, my beloved.|
 +   V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I ask that Euodia and Syntyche compromise and live harmoniously in the Lord. |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Yes, and I ask you too, my honest-to-goodness business partners, help them, they who are the very ones|
     v 3                                |who came and joined me in helping spread the Gospel (i.e., the message I’m spreading), which includes|
     v 3                                |Clement and the rest of my other fellow workers whose names are in the Book of Life.|
 +   V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Always rejoice in the Lord. I’ll say it again: rejoice. |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Let your courteous, generous, mild, gentle, kind, tolerant demeanor be made known to all people: the|
     v 5                                |Lord is nearby.|
 +   V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Don’t worry, be anxious, or have angst about anything, but instead in every situation and concerning|
     v 6                                |everything you need make your requests known to God by means of prayer and supplication with thanksgiving,|
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and the peace of God which transcends everything in your mind and transcends all mental activity will|
     v 7                                |guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.|
 +   V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In conclusion, comrades, whatsoever is true, whatsoever is honorable, whatsoever is right, whatsoever|
     v 8                                |is pure, whatsoever is admirable, whatsoever is laudable—let these things turn over in your head—let|
     v 8                                |your mind crunch these thoughts—figure these things out—meditate on them. |
     V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And what you learned, embraced, heard, and saw in me, put these things into practice, and the God of|
     v 9                                |peace will be with you.|
 +   V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I was just thrilled in the Lord that your consideration for how well-off I am has finally improved, in|
     v10                                |the respect that you considered my financial state of affairs over and over again but time and again|
     v10                                |lacked the opportunity to help me out financially. |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Not that I’m forced to speak this way out of lack, seeing that I’ve learned to be self-sufficient regardless|
     v11                                |of the situation I’m in. |
     V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I know from firsthand experience both how it is to be humbled (i.e., live in a financially bankrupted|
     v12                                |or impoverished condition) and how it is to be prosperous: in each and every circumstance I’ve learned|
     v12                                |the secret of every one of these: getting my belly filled, going hungry, prospering, and having a lack|
     v12                                |of provision: |
     V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |I can do anything by him who gives me the power. |
     V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Nevertheless it was a good thing that you did in commiserating with, sharing in, and partaking of my|
     v14                                |difficulties.|
 +   V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Now also, you know for a fact, Philippians, that in the early days of the Gospel when I left Macedonia,|
     v15                                |no church participated in regard to this matter of giving and receiving except for you only, |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |that once and again a second time while I was in Thessalonica you sent me a contribution to help with|
     v16                                |my needs. |
     V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Not that I’m fishing for handouts—no—I’m seeking the Fruit which is being multiplied and credited to|
     v17                                |your account. |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But I have everything I need and then some, having been resupplied by Epaphroditus by those things sent|
     v18                                |from you, a pleasant odor, an acceptable sacrifice, pleasing to God like the sacrifices offered to God|
     v18                                |in the Old Testament that He said pleased Him. |
     V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |My God shall supply all your needs reflective of His riches in glory in Christ Jesus. |
     V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But the glory be given to our God and Father forever and ever. Amen (i.e., let us pause a moment for|
     v20                                |that finishing remark to sink in).|
 +   V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Say hello to all the saints in Christ Jesus (i.e., those who believe in Christ) for me. The comrades|
     v21                                |with me extend their greetings to you as well. |
     V22              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |All the saints say hello, especially those who belong to Caesar’s household.|
 +   V23              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.|

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  THESS1 Introduction  <<<<<<<<<<<<

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  THESS1 Chapter 1  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 + N V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |From Paul, Silas, and Timothy:|
 +PN V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |To the church of Thessalonica in the Father-God and the Lord Jesus Christ:|
 +P  V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Grace to you and peace.|
 +   V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |We’re always thanking God for all of you, bringing you up in prayer, continuously |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |remembering your work of the Faith, your toil of the Love of God, and your steadfastness of the hope|
     v 3                                |of our Lord Jesus Christ in the sight of our God and Father, |

     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |that our Gospel, the glad-tidings message which drew us together, did not present itself to us in word|
     v 5                                |only but also in supernatural power and in the Holy Spirit and with much conviction, just as you know|
     v 5                                |full-well what sort of men we turned out to be while among you throughout our stay with you.|
 +   V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And you became people who imitate us and the Lord, having received (i.e., having fully embraced) the|
     v 6                                |word in the midst of a good deal of tribulation but with the joy of the Holy Spirit, |

     v 7                                |province of Asia.|
 +   V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In fact the word of the Lord sounded forth from you (i.e., you loudly and thoroughly announced, advertised,|

     v 8                                |in God went out, so much so that there’s no need for us to be doing any more talking. |

     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and to wait for His son to come out of heaven, whom He raised from the dead, Jesus who’s rescuing us|

 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In fact you yourselves know full-well, comrades, that the impact we had on you wasn’t a waste of time,|
     V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |rather, having suffered before and having been treated with insolence (as you’re well aware), in Philippi|
     v 2                                |we were emboldened in our God to tell you God’s good-news message, the Gospel, while in the face of a|
     v 2                                |lot of opposition. |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In fact, our encouragement was not from us being in error or from an uncleanness (i.e., something dirty,|
     v 3                                |impure, or something one should stay away from), nor did it exist in deceit or guile, |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |but instead it’s in line with the way we’ve been granted by God to be entrusted with the Gospel—that’s|
     v 4                                |the way we speak, not like we’re speaking to people in a way where we’re trying to make them happy but|
     v 4                                |like we’re speaking to God in a way to make Him happy instead, Who approves or disapproves of what’s|
     v 4                                |in our hearts. |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |For there was never a time when we showed up with a flattering message (as you’re well aware), nor did|
     v 5                                |we show up having a pretext for covetousness—so help me God— |
     V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |nor did we show up seeking prestige or fame, not from you or from anyone else, |
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |though, as Christ’s apostles, we’re capable of throwing our weight around. Instead, we became infants|
     v 7                                |while in your midst. The way a nursing mother cherishes her own children |
     V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |is the same way that we, having a strong yearning for you, thought it well to share not only the Gospel|
     v 8                                |of God but also the things that make us live and breathe themselves. Therefore, you became dear to us.|

     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |You—and God—can attest to just how pious, correct, and faultless the demeanor was that we presented to|
     v10                                |you who are believers. |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Just as you know from experience that we treated each one of you like a father treats his own children,|
     V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |we were comforting, exhorting, advising, consoling, cheering, and issuing statements for you to conduct|
     v12                                |your day to day lives in a manner worthy of God, Who calls us to His Own kingdom and glory.|
 +   V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |And we thank God continuously because of this as well, since, having received (i.e., wholeheartedly embraced)|
     v13                                |God’s message (His systematic reasoning; His word) verbally communicated from us to you, you didn’t receive|
     v13                                |a man-made message but instead you received it just as it actually is: God’s true message, a message|
     v13                                |which is also at work in you who believe.|
 +   V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |You see comrades, you followed the pattern set by the churches of God in Christ Jesus which are in Judea,|
     v14                                |in that you too suffered the same things done to you by your own countrymen like what was done to them|
     v14                                |by their fellow Judeans, |
     V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |who also killed the Lord Jesus and the Old Testament prophets and persecuted us. These countrymen live|
     v15                                |lives which are not pleasing to God; they are against all of humanity, |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |hindering us from getting to speak to the Gentiles so that they could be saved (i.e., receive Christ|
     v16                                |as savior), the end-result being that every time they commit sin, they do it to the maximum extent; the|
     v16                                |wrath of God came upon them to the utmost.|
 +   V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But we, comrades, bereft of you for a short while—bereft from being there in person with you and not|
     v17                                |bereft of heart—with tremendous desire we all the more hastened to see your faces. |
     V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Therefore we wanted to visit you—certainly I did, Paul—I started making arrangements once or twice but|

 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In conclusion, comrades, we ask you in the Lord—plead with you—that you go to higher and higher levels|
     v 1                                |in your being pleasing to God in your day to day lives in a way which is consistent with the instructions|
     v 1                                |you received from us (which is consistent with the way you are currently living your lives). |
     V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |The fact of the matter is that you know some of the instructions we gave you through the Lord Jesus.|
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In fact, this is the will of God (your holiness is the will of God!): it is for you to abstain from the|
     v 3                                |fornication you’re surrounded by (i.e., by the loose sexual morals we all know about); |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |for each of you to know how to gain possession and keep possession of his own personal container (i.e.,|
     v 4                                |his body, the container for his soul and spirit) in holiness and dignity, |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |not in an intense, all-consuming feeling of lust (just like the Gentiles who don’t know God) |
     V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |but in not stepping out of line and taking advantage of or defrauding his fellow-comrade in the matter|
     v 6                                |of sexual morality. Because of this the Lord takes vengeance in issues pertaining to these transgressions,|
     v 6                                |consistent with the way we told you previously, telling it in a dead-serious manner. |
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |The fact of the matter is that God has not called you to uncleanness (i.e., God’s intention for your|
     v 7                                |life in His kingdom was not to commit filthy, disgusting deeds) but rather to live in holiness. |
     V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Consequently, he who disregards this command isn’t disregarding a human being but is disregarding God|
     v 8                                |instead, Who gives His Holy Spirit to you.|
 +   V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Now about brotherly-love (i.e., having strong likings for other comrades): you don’t need to have any|
     v 9                                |instruction or advice written to you on this subject, seeing that you yourselves are God-instructed in|
     v 9                                |the love one should have for another. |
     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In fact, you also extend the same practices to all the comrades all over Macedonia. We beg you, comrades,|
     v10                                |to do even more |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and make it a goal to be still (i.e., not be stirred by loud, negative emotions), to do your own things|
     v11                                |(i.e., concentrate on your own lives), and to work with your own hands (i.e., don’t rely on others to|
     v11                                |do your work), and do these things in line with the way we recommended, |
     V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |so that the way you conduct your lives would leave a good impression on those on the outside and so that|
     v12                                |you won’t need anything.|
 +   V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |We don’t want you to be kept in the dark, comrades, about those who sleep (i.e., the believers who are|
     v13                                |already dead), so that you won’t grieve like the others, the ones who have no hope. |
     V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |To this point, if we believe that Jesus died and rose from the dead, then we are also entitled to believe|
     v14                                |that God will take those who sleep through Jesus (i.e., those who died trusting in Jesus) along together|
     v14                                |with him the same way. |
     V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In fact, we’re telling you this in a word of the Lord (i.e., in a prophetic message from the Lord): you|
     v15                                |the living who remain on the Earth until the coming of the Lord will absolutely not arrive at the destination|
     v15                                |before those who sleep, |
     V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |because the Lord himself—with the shout of a command by the voice of an archangel and by God’s bugle|
     v16                                |call—will come down from heaven, and first the dead in Christ will be resurrected (i.e., brought back|
     v16                                |to life), |
     V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |then you who are alive who remain on the Earth will be taken together with them as a single unit into|
     v17                                |the clouds to a meeting with the Lord in the air—And that’s the way we’ll always be with the Lord.|

  >>>>>>>>>>>>>>  THESS1 Chapter 5  <<<<<<<<<<<<
 +   V 1              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Concerning the times (i.e., the year, day, or month significant events will occur) and the seasons (i.e.,|
     v 1                                |the atmosphere that defines the era events occur in; the climate the events occur in), comrades, you|
     v 1                                |don’t need for me to write to you anything; |
     V 2              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |the fact is that you know full well in yourselves and to a tee that the nature of the day of the Lord|
     v 2                                |is that it comes in the same way as a thief in the night hits and runs. |
     V 3              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |When they (i.e., everybody out there) are saying, “Peace and security,” then suddenly and unexpectedly|
     v 3                                |destruction and ruin are perched on top of them staring down on them just like labor pains suddenly come|
     v 3                                |upon a pregnant woman and there’s no way she can run away at that point and escape them. |
     V 4              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But you, comrades, aren’t in darkness (i.e., you aren’t being kept in the dark about this) so that that|
     v 4                                |day would overwhelm you like a thief would; |
     V 5              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |for you all are sons of (i.e., you adopt the characteristics of) light and sons of day—We aren’t sons|
     v 5                                |of night or sons of darkness.|
 +   V 6              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |So then don’t sleep (i.e., becoming spiritually dormant) like everyone else, but be watchful (i.e., stay|
     v 6                                |focused) and sober (i.e., don’t let anything degrade your heightened state of alertness) instead. |
     V 7              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |You see, those who sleep do their sleeping at night, and those who are drunkards do their drinking at|
     v 7                                |night. |
     V 8              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |But you’re in a state where you’re sober during the day, now that you’ve put on a breast-plate of faith|
     v 8                                |and love and a helmet that is the hope of salvation (i.e., of escaping destruction, in this context the|
     v 8                                |wrath of God), |
     V 9              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |because God didn’t put us in a position that’s towards wrath but He put us in a position that’s headed|
     v 9                                |towards acquiring salvation (i.e., acquiring a means of escape, in this context from the wrath of God)|
     v 9                                |through our Lord Jesus Christ, |
     V10              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |who died for us so that whether we happen to watch (i.e., remain alive and stay focused) or whether we|
     v10                                |happen to sleep (i.e., die) we would live together in the same time and place with him. |
     V11              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |In light of this, comfort one another and edify each other one-on-one just like you’re already doing.|
 +   V12              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |We ask you, comrades, to know from first-hand observation those among you who do hard work and who have|
     v12                                |stepped forward to stand in leadership positions in the Lord and who advise, warn, admonish, and instruct|
     v12                                |you, |
   N V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |and to have a superabundant high regard for them in love on account of their work.|
 +P  V13              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Keep the peace among yourselves.|
 + N V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |We plead with you, comrades, that you advice, warn, admonish, and instruct the disorderly and insubordinate.|
 +PN V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Cheer up those who are discouraged.|
 +PN V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Take a strong interest in and help those who are weak (i.e., those who are unwell; worn out with a sickness;|
     v14                                |too physically weak to take care of themselves; powerless to do anything about their circumstances).|
 +P  V14              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Exercise patience with everyone.|
 +   V15              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |See that no one, when somebody does something bad to them, retaliates by doing something bad back to|
     v15                                |them, but instead pursues the common good and the general good at all times.|
 +   V16              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Rejoice all the time.|
 +   V17              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Pray incessantly.|
 +   V18              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Give thanks in the midst of all circumstances; you see, this is the will of God for you in Christ Jesus.|
 +   V19              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Do not extinguish or put out the Holy Spirit when he’s burning. Do not quench, stifle, or suppress the|
     v19                                |Holy Spirit.|
 +   V20              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Do not despise, treat with contempt, or have utter disdain for prophesy, |
     V21              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |but examine all things including prophesies instead and accept the good and reject the bad and hold onto|
     v21                                |the good.|
 +   V22              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Stay away from any appearance of evil or wrong-doing.|
 +   V23              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Now may the God of peace Himself set you apart so that you’re complete in all respects and so that you|
     v23                                |meet all expectations; may your spirit, soul, and body be blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.|
 +   V24              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Faithful is He Who calls us; He will do it.|
 +   V25              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Comrades, pray for us too.|
 +   V26              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Greet all the comrades with a holy hug.|
 +   V27              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |Make a promise to the Lord to have this letter read aloud to all the comrades, so everyone gets the chance|
     v27                                |to hear it.|
 +   V28              VERSES_NARRATIVE: |The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.|
